Reversion.origin: [Anglo-French, from Middle French, from Latin reversio act of turning back, from revertere to turn back]

1.definition: the returning of an estate upon its termination to the former owner or to his or her successor in interest

2 a.definition: the present vested interest in the residue of an estate that remains in its owner after the grant therefrom of a lesser estate (as a life estate) and that will commence in possession by operation of law upon termination of the lesser estate

sub_terms.b: the future interest in property left in a grantor or his or her successor in interest that is not subject to a condition precedent compare,
